meanings.definition: A building behind a main house, typically used for storage or as a bathroom.
meanings.sent1: The backhouse behind our home stores all the gardening tools.
meanings.sent2: The backhouse had a small window overlooking the garden.
meanings.sent3: We forgot to lock the backhouse, and now the raccoons are having a party in there!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a cluttered backhouse, full of forgotten memories and dusty dreams.
meanings.sent5: The backhouse smelled of damp earth and old wood, a comforting scent of nostalgia.

meanings.definition: The rear part of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailors gathered at the backhouse of the ship to watch the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The captain stood at the backhouse, gazing out at the vast ocean.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous crewmate hid in the backhouse to scare his friends.
meanings.sent4: The backhouse of the ship was a quiet retreat from the bustling deck.
meanings.sent5: The storm hit the backhouse first, rocking the ship with its powerful waves.

meanings.sent1: I will backhouse you in your decision to pursue your dreams.
meanings.sent2: She always backhouses her friends when they need a helping hand.
meanings.sent3: The siblings backhoused each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent4: His encouraging words backhoused her during the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to backhouse the family after the fire destroyed their home.
